<table bgColor="#ffffff" border="0" width="100%"> <tbody> <tr> <td align="center" rowspan="2"> <a href="index.html"><img border="0" alt="Padlock closed" title="Padlock closed" hspace="10" src="PadlockClosed.png" width="77" height="106" align="middle"/></a> </td> <td align="left"> <p> Security is an essential part of Web activity - this directory documents how to apply World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) security standards for XML Encryption (privacy) and XML Digital Signature (authentication) to X3D scenes. <p> <p> The <a href="X3dSecurityReadMe.html" target="_blank">X3D Security Examples</a> show how to use the <a href="http://www.w3.org/Security" target="_blank">World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Security Recommendations</a> for <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core" target="_blank">XML Signature</a> and <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core" target="_blank">XML Encryption</a> with X3D. <p> </td> <td align="left" rowspan="2"> <a href="index.html"><img border="0" alt="Padlock open" title="Padlock open" hspace="10" src="PadlockOpen.png" width="79" height="124" align="left"/></a> </td> </tr> <tr> <td> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dResources.html#Security" target="_blank">X3D Resources: Security</a> provides an additional set of security issues and resources. <a href="http://x3dgraphics.com/examples/X3dForAdvancedModeling/Security">Additional security examples</a> are being prepared as part of the <a href="http://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling" target="X3dChapterSlideset">X3D for Advanced Modeling</a> project. </td> </tr> </tbody> </table>
